radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild bibasal atelectasis. No large pleural effusions. No pericardial effusion. Lungs show mild bibasal atelectasis. The pancreas is diffusely enlarged and hypoenhancing with a small to moderate amount of peripancreatic fluid. No concerning lesions in liver or kidneys but a punctate lesion is noted in segment 5 of the liver likely representing a biliary hamartoma. Two punctate hypodensities in the right upper pole of the kidney are too small to characterize. No gas or perinephric fat stranding.
